Class GuestbookEntry

java.lang.Object
GuestbookEntry
public class GuestbookEntry extends Object
The GuestbookEntry class represents a single entry in the guestbook. It encapsulates details of a guestbook entry such as name, email, website, and comment. This class provides constructors for creating instances both with and without an entry ID, assuming the ID is auto-generated by the database when not provided.

  • Constructor Details

    • GuestbookEntry

      public GuestbookEntry(String name, String email, String website, String comment)
      Constructs a new GuestbookEntry with specified name, email, website, and comment. This constructor is typically used when creating a new entry where the ID is not yet assigned.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the person making the entry.
      email - The email address of the person making the entry.
      website - The website URL provided by the person, may be null if not provided.
      comment - The comment or message left in the guestbook.

    • GuestbookEntry

      public GuestbookEntry(int id, String name, String email, String website, String comment)
      Constructs a new GuestbookEntry with specified ID, name, email, website, and comment. This constructor is typically used when retrieving an existing entry from the database, where the entry already has an assigned ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for the guestbook entry.
      name - The name of the person making the entry.
      email - The email address of the person making the entry.
      website - The website URL provided by the person, may be null if not provided.
      comment - The comment or message left in the guestbook.

    • GuestbookEntry

      public GuestbookEntry()
      Default no-argument constructor for GuestbookEntry. Can be used to create an instance of GuestbookEntry without setting field values initially.
